To the chief Musician<S>5329</S> upon Shoshannim<S>7799</S>, A Psalm of David<S>1732</S>. Save<S>3467</S> me, O God<S>430</S>; for the waters<S>4325</S> are come<S>935</S> in unto my soul<S>5315</S>.
I sink<S>2883</S> in deep<S>4688</S> mire<S>3121</S>, where there is no standing<S>4613</S>: I am come<S>935</S> into deep<S>4615</S> waters<S>4325</S>, where the floods<S>7641</S> overflow<S>7857</S> me. <sup>deep mire: Heb. the mire of depth</sup> <sup>deep waters: Heb. depth of waters</sup>
I am weary<S>3021</S> of my crying<S>7121</S>: my throat<S>1627</S> is dried<S>2787</S>: mine eyes<S>5869</S> fail<S>3615</S> while I wait<S>3176</S> for my God<S>430</S>.
They that hate<S>8130</S> me without a cause<S>2600</S> are more<S>7231</S> than the hairs<S>8185</S> of mine head<S>7218</S>: they that would destroy<S>6789</S> me, being mine enemies<S>341</S> wrongfully<S>8267</S>, are mighty<S>6105</S>: then I restored<S>7725</S> that which I took not away<S>1497</S>.
O God<S>430</S>, thou knowest<S>3045</S> my foolishness<S>200</S>; and my sins<S>819</S> are not hid<S>3582</S> from thee. <sup>sins: Heb. guiltiness</sup>
Let not them that wait<S>6960</S> on thee, O Lord<S>136</S> GOD<S>3069</S> of hosts<S>6635</S>, be ashamed<S>954</S> for my sake: let not those that seek<S>1245</S> thee be confounded<S>3637</S> for my sake, O God<S>430</S> of Israel<S>3478</S>.
Because for thy sake I have borne<S>5375</S> reproach<S>2781</S>; shame<S>3639</S> hath covered<S>3680</S> my face<S>6440</S>.
I am become a stranger<S>2114</S> unto my brethren<S>251</S>, and an alien<S>5237</S> unto my mother's<S>517</S> children<S>1121</S>.
For the zeal<S>7068</S> of thine house<S>1004</S> hath eaten me up<S>398</S>; and the reproaches<S>2781</S> of them that reproached<S>2778</S> thee are fallen<S>5307</S> upon me.
When I wept<S>1058</S>, and chastened my soul<S>5315</S> with fasting<S>6685</S>, that was to my reproach<S>2781</S>.
I made<S>5414</S> sackcloth<S>8242</S> also my garment<S>3830</S>; and I became a proverb<S>4912</S> to them.
They that sit in<S>3427</S> the gate<S>8179</S> speak<S>7878</S> against me; and I was the song<S>5058</S> of the drunkards<S>8354</S> <S>7941</S>. <sup>drunkards: Heb. drinkers of strong drink</sup>
But as for me, my prayer<S>8605</S> is unto thee, O LORD<S>3068</S>, in an acceptable<S>7522</S> time<S>6256</S>: O God<S>430</S>, in the multitude<S>7230</S> of thy mercy<S>2617</S> hear<S>6030</S> me, in the truth<S>571</S> of thy salvation<S>3468</S>.
Deliver<S>5337</S> me out of the mire<S>2916</S>, and let me not sink<S>2883</S>: let me be delivered<S>5337</S> from them that hate<S>8130</S> me, and out of the deep<S>4615</S> waters<S>4325</S>.
Let not the waterflood<S>4325</S> <S>7641</S> overflow<S>7857</S> me, neither let the deep<S>4688</S> swallow me up<S>1104</S>, and let not the pit<S>875</S> shut<S>332</S> her mouth<S>6310</S> upon me.
Hear<S>6030</S> me, O LORD<S>3068</S>; for thy lovingkindness<S>2617</S> is good<S>2896</S>: turn<S>6437</S> unto me according to the multitude<S>7230</S> of thy tender mercies<S>7356</S>.
And hide<S>5641</S> not thy face<S>6440</S> from thy servant<S>5650</S>; for I am in trouble<S>6887</S>: hear<S>6030</S> me speedily<S>4118</S>. <sup>hear: Heb. make haste to hear me</sup>
Draw nigh<S>7126</S> unto my soul<S>5315</S>, and redeem<S>1350</S> it: deliver<S>6299</S> me because of mine enemies<S>341</S>.
Thou hast known<S>3045</S> my reproach<S>2781</S>, and my shame<S>1322</S>, and my dishonour<S>3639</S>: mine adversaries<S>6887</S> are all before thee.
Reproach<S>2781</S> hath broken<S>7665</S> my heart<S>3820</S>; and I am full of heaviness<S>5136</S>: and I looked<S>6960</S> for some to take pity<S>5110</S>, but there was none; and for comforters<S>5162</S>, but I found<S>4672</S> none. <sup>to take: Heb. to lament with me</sup>
They gave<S>5414</S> me also gall<S>7219</S> for my meat<S>1267</S>; and in my thirst<S>6772</S> they gave me vinegar<S>2558</S> to drink<S>8248</S>.
Let their table<S>7979</S> become a snare<S>6341</S> before<S>6440</S> them: and that which should have been for their welfare<S>7965</S>, let it become a trap<S>4170</S>.
Let their eyes<S>5869</S> be darkened<S>2821</S>, that they see<S>7200</S> not; and make their loins<S>4975</S> continually<S>8548</S> to shake<S>4571</S>.
Pour out<S>8210</S> thine indignation<S>2195</S> upon them, and let thy wrathful<S>2740</S> anger<S>639</S> take hold<S>5381</S> of them.
Let their habitation<S>2918</S> be desolate<S>8074</S>; and let none dwell<S>3427</S> in their tents<S>168</S>. <sup>their habitation: Heb. their palace</sup> <sup>let none: Heb. let there not be a dweller</sup>
For they persecute<S>7291</S> him whom thou hast smitten<S>5221</S>; and they talk<S>5608</S> to the grief<S>4341</S> of those whom thou hast wounded<S>2491</S>. <sup>those: Heb. thy wounded</sup>
Add<S>5414</S> iniquity<S>5771</S> unto their iniquity<S>5771</S>: and let them not come<S>935</S> into thy righteousness<S>6666</S>. <sup>iniquity unto: or, punishment of iniquity, etc</sup>
Let them be blotted<S>4229</S> out of the book<S>5612</S> of the living<S>2416</S>, and not be written<S>3789</S> with the righteous<S>6662</S>.
But I am poor<S>6041</S> and sorrowful<S>3510</S>: let thy salvation<S>3444</S>, O God<S>430</S>, set me up on high<S>7682</S>.
I will praise<S>1984</S> the name<S>8034</S> of God<S>430</S> with a song<S>7892</S>, and will magnify<S>1431</S> him with thanksgiving<S>8426</S>.
This also shall please<S>3190</S> the LORD<S>3068</S> better<S>3190</S> than an ox<S>7794</S> or bullock<S>6499</S> that hath horns<S>7160</S> and hoofs<S>6536</S>.
The humble<S>6035</S> shall see<S>7200</S> this, and be glad<S>8055</S>: and your heart<S>3824</S> shall live<S>2421</S> that seek<S>1875</S> God<S>430</S>. <sup>humble: or, meek</sup>
For the LORD<S>3068</S> heareth<S>8085</S> the poor<S>34</S>, and despiseth<S>959</S> not his prisoners<S>615</S>.
Let the heaven<S>8064</S> and earth<S>776</S> praise<S>1984</S> him, the seas<S>3220</S>, and every thing that moveth<S>7430</S> therein. <sup>moveth: Heb. creepeth</sup>
For God<S>430</S> will save<S>3467</S> Zion<S>6726</S>, and will build<S>1129</S> the cities<S>5892</S> of Judah<S>3063</S>: that they may dwell<S>3427</S> there, and have it in possession<S>3423</S>.
The seed<S>2233</S> also of his servants<S>5650</S> shall inherit<S>5157</S> it: and they that love<S>157</S> his name<S>8034</S> shall dwell<S>7931</S> therein.
